body.name: The Woman Beneath the Stairs: A gripping psychological thriller with a shocking twist

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Edge of your seat suspense
reviews.reviewText: The Woman Beneath The Stairs is the best psychological suspense I’ve read in a long time. Brilliantly written, it grabs you and won’t let go.Tim and Ally embark on a trip to Maine to see his ill mother and twin brother Tom. When they arrive at the home on a private island things aren’t as expected. When the police arrive looking for a missing woman and try to implicate her husband she isn’t sure what to believe. Soon bodies are stacking up, their boat is sabotaged, and they have no communication with the outside world.Ally is already struggling with depression and taking medication. When she starts to hear a woman’s voice she wonders if what’s she’s experiencing is real or a figment of her imagination. She needs to find out the truth.Each person in the book has quirks, attitudes, or physical characteristics that set them apart from the rest making it interesting while strengthening the mystery as to who is actually committing murder on the island, and why.I love a book that keeps me guessing right to the end and this one hit the mark. It was perfectly paced, with each clue hidden within diversions that sent me on a few side paths leading in different directions. Add in plenty of heart pounding action and I couldn’t put it down. I highly recommend this book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Loved this book!!
reviews.reviewText: I just loved this book. When I started reading it I could not put it down. All the twist and turns were so great that it made me want to keep reading to see how you could get the people out of the different situations. I have read all your Jack Stratton books and loved each one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The Woman Beneath the Stairs
reviews.reviewText: Mr. Greyson as always entices readers with a diabolical mystery. This one is about an absurdly dysfunctional family. We have a hypochondriacal matriarch, a “superhero” twin, the unknowing husband, the depressed wife, more twins, Uncle Phillip and so much more. Old bodies, new bodies, and almost more bodies than can be counted. Readers, however, can count on the author for an interesting twist.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Kept me guessing until the end. A mystery thriller you can not put down. Very well written. Twists and turns that makes you think what is going to happen in the end but then your wrong again and again. I love Christopher Greyson books. Looking forward to my next read.
